title: [K-12] Constructivist English Collaborative Education Curriculum for Academic Preparation

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level English proficiency and awareness of college academic preparedness requirements
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment for adult ESL learners preparing for U.S. university admission, focusing on academic English proficiency development

learning_goals: Enhance the ability to analyze academic papers and lecture materials to identify and summarize key concepts.

Learners can demonstrate communication skills in academic presentations or discussions by using 10 logical English expressions (connectors, evidence structures, etc.) to meet four or more of the five evaluation rubric criteria in a 5-minute presentation or 3-person discussion.

Learners submit three academic writings (essays/reports) through a peer review system, earning 4+ points (5-point scale) from two peer reviewers for structural completeness (clarity of introduction-body-conclusion, logical flow) and linguistic accuracy (grammar, vocabulary, expression), and incorporate 70% or more of the feedback in the final revised version.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
